sg.yeefan.searchenginewrapper
Interface SearchEngineClient

All Known Subinterfaces:
KeyedSearchEngineClient
All Known Implementing Classes:
BingClient, DuckDuckGoClient, FacebookClient, GoogleCustomClient, TwitterClient, WikipediaClient
public interface SearchEngineClient

Interface for a search engine client.

Sample usage: 


 SearchEngineClient client = SearchEngineClientFactory.getClient(name);
 DefaultSearchEngineQuery defaultQuery = new DefaultSearchEngineQuery();
 // Set the query parameters...
 SearchEngineQuery query = defaultQuery;
 int maxNumQueries = 5;
 for (int i = 0; i < maxNumQueries; i++) {
     results = client.getResults(query);
     // Process results...
     query = results.getNextQuery();
     if (query == null)
         break;
 }
Implementation notes: A class implementing the SearchEngineClient interface should contain a no-argument constructor.

Author:
Tan Yee Fan
See Also:
SearchEngineClientFactory, SearchEngineWrapper

Method Summary
 SearchEngineResults getResults(SearchEngineQuery query)
          Makes a query to the search engine and returns its results.
 

Method Detail

getResults

SearchEngineResults getResults(SearchEngineQuery query)
                               throws SearchEngineException
Makes a query to the search engine and returns its results.

Parameters:
query - The search engine query.
Throws:
SearchEngineFatalException - If a fatal error occurred during the querying.
SearchEngineQuotaException - If the quota for the (rate-limited) allowable number of queries has been exceeded.
SearchEngineException - If any other error occurred during the querying.
